footnotes.content: IDC's Global DataSphere forecast measured 120 zettabytes of data created globally in 2023, with a compound annual growth rate (CAGR) of 23% from 2018-2023.
Conservative estimate based on 120 ZB in 2023 growing at 23% annually yields 175-182 ZB for 2025. The 175 ZB figure assumes slight deceleration to ~21% growth in 2025.
IDC's 2023 survey found that approximately 80% of enterprise data is unstructured—including emails, documents, images, videos, and sensor logs—as opposed to structured database records.
Long-grain white rice averages 50 cubic millimeters (mm³) in volume, based on USDA Agricultural Research Service measurements of standard varieties.
Lake Superior contains approximately 12,100 cubic kilometers of water, making it the largest freshwater lake by surface area in the world and containing roughly 10% of the world's surface freshwater.
footnotes.source: NOAA Great Lakes Environmental Research Laboratory

footnotes.content: FINA (World Aquatics) standards specify Olympic swimming pools as 50 meters long × 25 meters wide × minimum 2 meters deep, yielding 2,500 cubic meters of volume.
The Commodore 64, released in 1982, featured 64 kilobytes of RAM and became one of the best-selling personal computers of all time, with estimated sales of 12-17 million units.

Estimated based on Apple H2 chip specifications: AAC-LC audio (256 kbps Bluetooth), spatial audio processing (48 kHz sample rate), and active noise cancellation (200 Hz environmental sampling). Total processing estimated at ~1.16 GB per hour.
footnotes.source: Calculated from Apple AirPods Pro specifications

footnotes.content: Statista projects global data center electricity consumption will reach approximately 1,050 terawatt-hours (TWh) annually by 2026, roughly equivalent to Japan's total electricity consumption.
Claude Shannon's 1948 paper 'A Mathematical Theory of Communication' established the bit as the fundamental unit of information and laid the foundation for all digital communication.
footnotes.source: Shannon, C.E. (1948). Bell System Technical Journal
